document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Solier, A. J. J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Solier, A. J. J. (1849) Orden III. Coleopteros. [Pentamera]. In: Gay, C. (Ed.), Historia fisica y politica de Chile. Zoologia. Vol. 4. C. Gay, Paris. pp. 105 - 380, pl. 1 - 12.

bibRefCitation.author: Cameron, M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Cameron, M. (1941) New species of Staphylinidae (Col.) from the Philippines. The Annals and Magazine of Natural History, (serie 11), 8 (47), 379 - 403. https: // doi. org / 10.1080 / 00222934108527218

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from South America.
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

bibRefCitation.author: Bernhauer, M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Bernhauer, M. (1907) Neue Staphyliniden aus Sudamerika. 4. Stuck. Wiener Entomologische Zeitung, 26 (7 - 9), 281 - 289. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. part. 8892

subSubSection.paragraph: 6 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Characters/Description: Blackwelder 1943: 394 (characters in key), 458 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 131 (characters in key).
Key: Blackwelder 1943: 459 (species of the West Indies).

bibRefCitation.author: Mannerheim, C. G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Mannerheim, C. G. (1831) Precis d'un nouvel arrangement de la famille des brachelytres de l'ordre des insectes coleopteres. Memoires presentes a l'Academie Imperiale de Sciences de St. - Petersbourg par Divers Savans, 1, 415 - 501.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Epipeda
Mulsant & Rey, 1871: 136
[synonymized by
Bernhauer & Scheerpeltz 1926: 545
]

subSubSection.paragraph: 23 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Characters/Description: Lynch-Arribálzaga 1884: 55 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 131 (characters in key). Distribution.
South America: Venezuela , French Guiana , Ecuador , Brazil , Paraguay , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Oceanic.

bibRefCitation.author: Erichson, G. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Erichson, G. F. (1839 a) Genera et species staphylinorum insectorum coleopterorum familiae. F. H. Morin, Berlin. viii + 400 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from South America.
4 species are included in this genus from the West Indies and South America.
Key: Klimaszewski & Peck 1998: 230 (species of the Galapagos Isl.); Newton & Peck 2006: 137 (species of the Galapagos Isl.).
South America: Colombia , Galapagos Isl., Bolivia , Brazil , Chile , Argentina .
